1.text: Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,

2.text: to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all humility toward all men.

3.text: For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

4.text: But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,

5.text: not by works of righteousness, which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,

6.text: whom he poured out on us richly, through Jesus Christ our Savior;

7.text: that, being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

8.text: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;

9.text: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

10.text: Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning;

11.text: knowing that such a one is perverted, and sins, being self-condemned.

12.text: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.

13.text: Send Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them.

14.text: Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.

15.text: All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
